info.description:
# Purpose

The purpose of the hierarchy API is to access and modify the Enlight asset hierarchy as well as closely related concepts such as origins, asset components and asset taxonomy.

# Definitions

The hierarchy is made up of companies, plants, systems, functional locations, assets, measurement points, lubrication points and inspection points. Collectively, these are referred to as *Nodes*. Nodes imported from other systems have an *origin* that acts as a reference to the resourse in the source system. Nodes can also have *components* attached to them. *Components* represent physical parts of a machine, such as bearings or shafts.

# Hierarchy

This part of the API is used to [create](#/Hierarchy/post_nodes), [update](#/Hierarchy/put_nodes__node_) and [delete](#/Hierarchy/delete_nodes__node_) hierarchy nodes. There are also endpoints for getting the company node under which a given node is located, getting the ancestor nodes of a given node, getting the descendants of a node, duplicating a given node and its descendants as well as deleting the origin of a node.

## Nodes

Nodes are expected to contain a different set of properties depending on the type of the node. See the Models section for information about the different node types.

## Origin

An origin on a node signifies that the node is synchronized from an external system, such as @Observer or @Analyst. Nodes with an origin cannot be modified, since any changes to the node would be overwritten by the sychronization job. To modify an imported node, the synchronization job first needs to be deleted. Deleting the synchronization job also deletes the origin on the nodes under that company.

## Metadata

The field *metaData* can be used to store user defined keys, with optional values, on a node. Keys need to be strings, while values are strings or *null*. Certain keys may need special privileges to update. For backwards compatibility, the contents of this field is also reflected in the field *tags*. The *togs* field represents the keys and values as a comma-separated list, with keys and values separated by an equality sign.

### Example
Given the following *metaData*
```json
{
    "tag": null,
    "tag2": "value"
}
```
the *tags* field would contain `"tag,tag2=value"`.

### Creating and updating

Since both the *tags* and *metaData* fields are generated from the same data, changes to either field is also reflected on the other. When creating or updating a node, the resulting metadata is the union of the data in *tags* and *metaData*. If a key has been specified in both the *tags* field and in *metaData*, the value in *tags* takes precedence.

### Limitations

To prevent abuse of the metadata, the following limits are enforced on the data:

| Property       | Limit |
|----------------|-------|
| Number of keys | 50    |
| Key length     | 128   |
| Value length   | 256   |

Keys are restricted to alphanumeric characters as well as the characters `+-=._:/@`.

# Asset Components

- [Get](#/Asset%20Components/get_assets__node__components) components
- [Create](#/Asset%20Components/post_assets__node__components) components
- [Modify](#/Asset%20Components/put_assets__node__components__component_) components
- [Delete](#/Asset%20Components/delete_assets__node__components__component_) components

# Node Origins

- Get nodes by full or partial origin definition
- Get origins matching a partial origin definition

# Hierarchy Event Stream

- Get events that modify the hierarchy

# Asset Taxonomy

- Get known asset classes, types and sequences

# Security
## Access Token

All operations require an Access Token belonging to the user. For security reasons, the Identity Token is not allowed. The key should be provided in the header *Authorization*.
info.title: Hierarchy API

get.summary: Get all components belonging to an asset

parameters.description: Skip the first _offset_ components in the result
parameters.name: offset

200.description: Requested components belonging to the asset

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

404.description: The supplied asset does not exist

post.summary: Create a new component, such as bearings and shafts

parameters.description: Creates a Shaft or Bearing component
parameters.name: Component

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

404.description: The requested asset does not exist

409.description: Supplied component id does already exist

get.summary: Get a specific Component belonging to an asset

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

404.description: The requested component or asset does not exist

parameters.description: Updates a Shaft or Bearing component
parameters.name: Component

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

404.description: The specified component, asset or attached component does not exist

delete.summary: Delete a component and all its attached components

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description:
Gets a list of events from the given timestamp. The number of returned events
can be limited with the _limit_ query param. Call this repeatedly until no more
events are returned.
get.summary: Gets a list of events from a timestamp

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

post.description:
Create a new node. Depending on which type of node is to be created, different fields
are mandatory. At the very least, specify the fields in the Node data type.

parameters.description: Creates a node wth these properties, can't contain mismatch of type specific data (e.g. a inspection point can't popluate the 'volume' field)
parameters.name: Node

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

409.description: Node with the specified origin already exists

get.description: Gets the node with the given ID

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

parameters.description: Updates the nodes fields with these values, can't contain mismatch of type specific data (e.g. a inspection point can't popluate the 'volume' field)
parameters.name: Node

parameters.description: Node ID of node to update
parameters.name: node

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

delete.description: Deletes the node with the given ID. The delete works recursively on the given nodes' children.

parameters.description: Node ID of node to remove
parameters.name: node

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description: Gets the ancestor nodes for the node with the given ID, ordered by ascending distance from the source node.

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description: Gets the company node for the node with the given ID.
get.summary: Gets the company node for any given node in the hierarchy

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

post.description: Duplicates a existing node and puts it under same parent node or a new parent if _dstParentNodeId_ is given.

parameters.description: Node ID of new parent to the duplicate
parameters.name: dstParentNodeId

200.description: Node successfully duplicated. _nodeId_ is ID of new node.

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

delete.description: Deletes the origin of the node with the given ID. The delete optionally works recursively on the given nodes' children.
delete.summary: Deletes the origin of a node

parameters.description: Node ID to remove origin for
parameters.name: node

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description: Gets a sub tree rooted at the node with the given ID

parameters.description: Skip the first _offset_ nodes in the result
parameters.name: offset

parameters.description: Only return nodes having the given metadata key
parameters.name: metadata_key

parameters.description: Only return nodes where the value corresponding to metadata_key matches the given value
parameters.name: metadata_value

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description: Gets the node count of a sub tree rooted at the node with the given ID
get.summary: Gets node count in a subtree

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description:
Tries to fetch an origin based on origin provider.
If no origin matches, an empty list will be returned.
get.summary: Fetch an origin based on origin provider

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description:
Tries to fetch node IDs based on origin provider.
If no node has an origin that matches, an empty list will be returned.
get.summary: Fetch node IDs based on origin provider

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description:
Tries to fetch an origin based on origin provider and type.
If no origin matches, an empty list will be returned.
get.summary: Fetch an origin based on origin provider and type

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description:
Tries to fetch node IDs based on origin provider and type.
If no node has an origin that matches, an empty list will be returned.
get.summary: Fetch node IDs based on origin provider and type

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

get.description: Fetches a node ID connected to a given origin.
get.summary: Fetch a node ID connected to a given origin.

400.description: The supplied parameters did not meet the requirements

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

404.description: No node with the given origin found

get.description: Gets known asset classes, asset types within each class, and sequences within each asset type.

401.description: Invalid or no access token provided

answers.description: Possible answers for single_choice and multi_choice inspections. Only valid for inspection point type nodes

assetClass.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

assetSequence.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

assetType.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

bearing.description: Bearing number on this asset. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

country.description: Which country the node is in. Only valid for site type node

criticality.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

dadType.description: Type of device used to take measurements on this point. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

fixedSpeedRpm.description: Speed in RPM if this shaft has a fixed speed. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

id.description: ID of node, as a UUID

industrySegment.description: Industry segment of this node. Only valid for site type node

locationId.description: ID of measurement point location. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

lubricant.description: Type of lubricant used. Only valid for lubrication point type nodes

lubricantUnit.description: Unit that the volume is specified in. Only valid for lubrication point type nodes

lubricantVolume.description: Volume of lubricant, in the given unit. Only valid for lubrication point type nodes

lubricateInstructions.description: Instruction for lubrication activity. Only valid for lubrication point type nodes

lubricateInterval.description: Interval between lubrication in days. Only valid for lubrication point type nodes

lubricationActivityAssetState.description: ActivityAssetState the asset should be in during the lubrication activity. Only valid for lubrication point type nodes

manufacturer.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

measurementType.description: Type of measurement. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

metaData.description: Metadata with keys and optional values

model.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

orientation.description: Orientation of measurement. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

origin.description: Origin of node, if imported from another system

parentId.description: ID of parent node, as a UUID

position.description: Relative position of node in the Enlight Centre UI

postalCode.description: Which postal code the site has. Only valid for site type node

serialNumber.description: Only valid for asset type nodes

shaft.description: Identifier of shaft that this measurement point belongs to. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

shaftSide.description: Which side of the given shaft this measurement point belongs to. Only valid for measurement point type nodes

tags.description: Comma separated list of free form tags on this node

unit.description: Unit of the value recorded, in case of numeric inspection. Only valid for inspection point type nodes

valueType.description: Type of value to record. Only valid for inspection point type nodes

visualizationMaxValue.description: Only valid for inspection point type nodes

visualizationMinValue.description: Only valid for inspection point type nodes

visualizationType.description: Type of visualization in Enlight Centre. Only valid for inspection point type nodes
